_data.description: Empower your NuxtJS application with @nuxt/content module: write in a content/ directory and fetch your Markdown, JSON, YAML and CSV files through a MongoDB like API, acting as a Git-based Headless CMS.
_data.title: Getting started

children.value: directory and fetch your Markdown, JSON, YAML and CSV files through a MongoDB like API, acting as a
, supporting Markdown, YAML, CSV and JSON:
Learn how to fetch your content with
Learn how to display your Markdown content with the

_data.text:
Empower your NuxtJS application with `@nuxtjs/content` module: write in a `content/` directory and fetch your Markdown, JSON, YAML and CSV files through a MongoDB like API, acting as a **Git-based Headless CMS**.

## Writing content

Learn how to write your `content/`, supporting Markdown, YAML, CSV and JSON: https://content.nuxtjs.org/writing.

## Fetching content

Learn how to fetch your content with `$content`: https://content.nuxtjs.org/fetching.

## Displaying content

Learn how to display your Markdown content with the `<nuxt-content>` component directly in your template: https://content.nuxtjs.org/displaying.

documentation.text:
@dev Creates `amount` new tokens for `to`.
 See {ERC20-_mint}.
 Requirements:
 - a caller must be the owner

@dev Pauses all token transfers.
 See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_pause}.
 Requirements
 - a caller must be the owner

@dev Unpauses all token transfers.
 See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_unpause}.
 Requirements:
 - a caller must be the owner

attributes.text:
@dev Creates `amount` new tokens for `to`.
 See {ERC20-_mint}.
 Requirements:
 - a caller must be the owner

@dev Pauses all token transfers.
 See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_pause}.
 Requirements
 - a caller must be the owner

@dev Unpauses all token transfers.
 See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_unpause}.
 Requirements:
 - a caller must be the owner

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

mint(address,uint256).details: Creates `amount` new tokens for `to`. See {ERC20-_mint}. Requirements: - a caller must be the owner

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Pauses all token transfers. See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_pause}. Requirements - a caller must be the owner

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Unpauses all token transfers. See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_unpause}. Requirements: - a caller must be the owner

documentation.text: Returns the current balance of the user. If it's not registered we return 0.

We determine if a user is registered with our contract by checking last value of claiming.
 It is equal or bigger than CALENDAR_MARK and 0 by default for unset.
Adds users allowed for periodic claiming.

attributes.text: Returns the current balance of the user. If it's not registered we return 0.

We determine if a user is registered with our contract by checking last value of claiming.
 It is equal or bigger than CALENDAR_MARK and 0 by default for unset.
Adds users allowed for periodic claiming.
Allows user to claim his tokens once per month, with no accumulation.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Address hasn't been added to the list of claimers."

attributes.text: Calculates start and end timestamps, which will be the first days at midnight of appropriate months.
Returns a number that can be used for month comparing and delta calculation

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addClaimers(address[]).notice: Adds users allowed for periodic claiming.

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the current balance of the user. If it's not registered we return 0.

calculateTimeBounds(uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates start and end timestamps, which will be the first days at midnight of appropriate months.

claimMonthly().notice: Allows user to claim his tokens once per month, with no accumulation.

getMonthOrdinal(uint256).notice: Returns a number that can be used for month comparing and delta calculation

isClaimer(address).notice: We determine if a user is registered with our contract by checking last value of claiming. It is equal or bigger than CALENDAR_MARK and 0 by default for unset.
